snippet: Ukrainian officials said they had suspended offensive operations against pro-Russia rebels to allow the monitors to reach the site safely.
abstract: Ukrainian officials suspend offensive operations against rebels in eastern Ukraine to finally allow international monitors to reach crash site of Malaysian Airlines Flight 17; members of Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe are limiting their work to initial reconnaissance and preparing the way for search and recovery work by a larger team

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and ANDREW ROTH
byline.contributor: Andrew Roth reported from Shakhtyorsk, and Andrew E. Kramer from Donetsk, Ukraine. Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Ukrainian officials said they had suspended offensive operations against pro-Russia rebels to allow the monitors to reach the site safely.

headline.main: Break in Fighting Lets International Team Reach Site of Ukraine Crash
headline.print_headline: Break in Fighting Lets International Team Reach Site of Ukraine Crash

keywords.value: Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe
